ul.li: Imagine a row of four colours. The possible colours are red, yellow, green, blue, black and white.

When the computer guesses a row, enter a value for the number of matching columns and the number of matching colours. Counting works as follows:
Count the columns where the colours are equal. Enter that value in the left drop down box.
For each of the remaining colours (in non-matching columns), check if a corresponding colour exists that has not yet been counted (note that colours may occur several times, so make sure to count each occurrence only once). The number of these colours should be entered in the right drop down box.
Needless to say, when you are done, press the Next move button.

div.p: In the SVG view, black pins represent matching columns, while white pins represent matching colours on a wrong position.
